{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3350885,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:07:45.199Z","cooked":"

Looking for advice about what to do with the SparkFlexes with Vortexes on our drivetrain.
We’re doing week 1, 4 and 6. Six is coming up and something is worrying me and I don’t know if it is really the SparkFlexes, but all the errors are coming from them. We have SparkFlexes running our swerve drives and our shooter flywheels, so six total. All other motors are run by SparkMaxes.
The swerve driving was great in week 1. In week 4 we were having intermittent jitters. Now with week six coming up we are getting CAN TC/RX errors and Over Currents on our Spark Flexes every match, as opposed to just occasionally… They are often fine on a power up for a few minutes, and then we start getting these errors.
The SparkMaxes on the turning motors and the other mechanisms (intake, arms, indexer) are rock solid and almost never report a CAN error or overcurrent. Plus our other swerve base from last year still runs great on all SparkMaxes - we don’t get seem to these errors.
So I am looking for some advice on preventitive maintenance.

  • Have other teams had good results with demounting the Vortex from the SparkFlex and reconnecting them? I only see it occasionally mentioned in other threads. Did this procedure definitely solve a problem, and does anyone see it as a necessary item of preventative maintenance between comps?
  • Have other teams experienced the increasing over current errors with time?
    Thanks!
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:07:45.199Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":409,"readers_count":408,"score":296.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"CJ Hill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32094,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/1","custom_user_title":"2429 mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3350889,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:12:09.484Z","cooked":"

Make sure you are running the latest version of the firmware and REVlib. There have been updates over the season as things have come up.

If you are seeing anything that is out of the normal, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us and we will help to diagnose any issues that you see.

Thanks! I have the newest version (24.0.8 as of whenever it came out), (and also tried going back a few) but we seem to see it on all the recent versions we’ve tried.
Also, love the products. Just trying to figure out if others are having any issues after a season of use. Is there any merit to the re-seating idea?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:19:20.568Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":353,"readers_count":352,"score":90.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"CJ Hill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":511,"username":"Greg_Needel","name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32094,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/3","custom_user_title":"2429 mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350892,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:19:53.661Z","cooked":"

A couple quick questions.

What are the current limits set on your motors?
Are you calling factory reset in your code every match?
How many parameters are you setting on these devices in code?
Are you burning the parameters to flash?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:19:53.661Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":330,"readers_count":329,"score":91.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"reply_to_user":{"id":32094,"username":"CJ_Hill","name":"CJ Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350895,"name":"Leo","username":"leo-les","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:21:31.960Z","cooked":"

Have you replaced any of the drive vortexes since you had these issues? And has that fixed the issues? (even in only temporarily)

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:21:31.960Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":306,"readers_count":305,"score":71.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/5","custom_user_title":"3128 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350907,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:28:18.610Z","cooked":"

Repo here, but in a nutshell we have a configure controllers script that runs on each motor and sets all the PID, MIN/Max output, voltage compensation. We usually burn it.
Every time we start with a (I’m rearranging a bit to show the important parts):

        kDrivingMotorCurrentLimit = 80  # amp
        self.drivingSparkMax.restoreFactoryDefaults()
        self.drivingSparkMax.setIdleMode(ModuleConstants.kDrivingMotorIdleMode)
        self.drivingSparkMax.setSmartCurrentLimit(ModuleConstants.kDrivingMotorCurrentLimit)
        self.drivingSparkMax.setInverted(driving_inverted)
        self.drivingSparkMax.enableVoltageCompensation(constants.k_volt_compensation)

Follow up with the PID stuff, and then usually burn.

So, in summary

  • 80A current limit, yes on factory reset, about ten parameters, and we flash.
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:36:32.504Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"CJ Hill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/aesatchien/FRC2429_2024/blob/main/robot/misc/configure_controllers.py","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC2429_2024/robot/misc/configure_controllers.py at main · aesatchien/FRC2429_2024 · GitHub","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":511,"username":"Greg_Needel","name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32094,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/6","custom_user_title":"2429 mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350909,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:30:39.127Z","cooked":"

We’re about to try, but we only have two spares. The problem for us is isolating which one of the SparkFlexes (if any) is causing the issues, because we can’t tell which one of the six is the problem.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:31:14.788Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":264,"readers_count":263,"score":52.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"CJ Hill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53083,"username":"leo-les","name":"Leo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32094,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/7","custom_user_title":"2429 mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350915,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T23:35:04.654Z","cooked":"

What we’ve done now is to write a “CANStatus” command which we can run when disabled, where it asks all of the Sparks for their fault status. We’re going to see if we can isolate one as the canary in the coalmine and swap it. We’re not exactly desparate since it works fine (usually) for a minute or two, but we can’t compete this way.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T23:35:04.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"CJ Hill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32094,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/8","custom_user_title":"2429 mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350987,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T00:56:41.832Z","cooked":"

We removed the flexes and put solo adapters on to use sparkmaxes. The flexes started giving us all kinds of issues halfway through our week 4 event. No one could figure out why either.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T00:56:41.832Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/9","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351020,"name":"","username":"Narnillian","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/6a8cbe/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T01:32:29.276Z","cooked":"
Greg_Needel:

Are you calling factory reset in your code every match?

Btw are you saying this is good or bad practice? I had just assumed that it would be the easiest way to make sure our settings haven’t been modified by accident.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T01:32:29.276Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":52.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55138,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351157,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T03:33:32.302Z","cooked":"

If you are burning to flash and have a known good settings, there isn’t really a need to reset every time.

By resetting to default you are relying on setting the parameters in code each time. If for a number of reasons including can bus errors something doesn’t set, you won’t have that parameter. With the latest REVlib there are additions that make setting parameters more robust.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T03:33:32.302Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"reply_to_user":{"id":55138,"username":"Narnillian","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/6a8cbe/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351287,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:54:18.592Z","cooked":"

Out of curiosity is there a feature where you can get the hash of configurable settings (aggregated, not singular although that would be nice too) and check it so you don’t need to restore factory defaults and burn flash.

As a side note, i have seen teams bit by this which was more difficult to debug bc the lack of factory defaults and burning to flash. Your point stands in regards to robustness and CAN failure tolerance.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:54:18.592Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461113,"topic_slug":"spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":511,"username":"Greg_Needel","name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/spark-flex-vortex-preventative-maintenance/461113/12","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351397,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T14:41:52.637Z","cooked":"

Last night the students demounted all six vortexes and remounted them to the flex base. We followed that up with replacing the one that seemed the worst offender, but since I couldn’t identify who was the worst that choice was a bit of a straw poll.
The CAN errors and overcurrents dramatically reduced. We used our other spare and that helped as well. We now seem to have the TX/RX and overcurrent errors only only on the older ones, which is itself a good data point for us, especially for monitoring going forward.
Things are much better, and we did not touch the CAN network in this process.
We did implement a new command that checks all the Sparks (Max and Flex) so that we can query everything w/o the hardware client. I will update it to log to the rio with a timestamp so we can track install date and frequency of sticky errors.

Looking forward, after things got better I then changed the code to not reset to defaults on boot. I had been doing that based on previous years with the SparkMax and past threads under the logic that if we had to swap one out at comp that would ensure we were treating the new and old ones the same. I think not resetting is probably going to be a big help (thanks to @Greg_Needel for pointing that out).
I always have our initial motor config script report the kOk responses at boot but I rarely read them, so I will start logging them as well. I have noticed other posters who do this to make sure every command is acknowledged. This combined with the fault recording script hopefully will guide us if we have future problems.
